meanings.definition: A form of acrostic in which the last letters of each line spell out a word or message.
meanings.sent1: In the poetry class, we learned about telestichs, where the final letters of each line create a hidden word.
meanings.sent2: The telestichs in the poem revealed a secret message when read vertically.
meanings.sent3: The telestichs in the song made the listeners try to guess the hidden word at the end of each line.
meanings.sent4: Her telestichs were like a puzzle waiting to be solved, adding an element of mystery to her writing.
meanings.sent5: The telestichs in the story were so cleverly crafted that they left a lasting impression on the readers.

meanings.definition: The practice of composing verses in such a way that the initial letters of each line form a word or message.
meanings.sent1: During the poetry competition, the young poet impressed the judges with her telestichs, where the first letters of each line spelled out a word.
meanings.sent2: The telestichs in his latest poem formed the name of his beloved, showcasing his creativity.
meanings.sent3: The telestichs in the nursery rhyme made the children giggle as they tried to figure out the hidden word.
meanings.sent4: His telestichs were like a beacon of light, guiding the readers through the verses with a hidden message.
meanings.sent5: The telestichs in the haiku were so beautifully crafted that they added an extra layer of depth to the short poem.
